conclusion: To find the work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C, we can use the area under the PV curve for the process since work done (W) in an isobaric process is given by: W = P ΔV.
The process from B to C is isobaric (constant pressure), and the pressure remains constant at 0.6p0.
From the diagram, the pressure at state B and C is 0.6p0.
The volume changes from 0.5V0 (state B) to V0 (state C).

premise: The volume changes from 0.5V0 (state B) to V0 (state C).
W = P ΔV and P = 0.6p0, ΔV = 0.5V0
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is calculated as 0.3p0V0.
conclusion: The work done by the gas to the outside world is -0.3p0V0
